# cloudtemple_object_storage_bucket (Data Source)

Used to retrieve information about a specific bucket.

To query this datasource you will need the `object-storage_read` role.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "cloudtemple_object_storage_bucket" "example" {
  name = "my-bucket-name"
}

output "bucket_id" {
  value = data.cloudtemple_object_storage_bucket.example
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) The name of the bucket.

### Read-Only

- `endpoint` (String) The endpoint URL of the bucket.
- `id` (String) The ID of the bucket.
- `namespace` (String) The namespace of the bucket.
- `retention_period` (Number) The retention period of the bucket in days.
- `tags` (List of Object) The tags associated with the bucket. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--tags))
- `total_objects` (Number) The total number of objects in the bucket.
- `total_objects_deleted` (String) The total number of deleted objects in the bucket.
- `total_size` (String) The total size of the bucket in bytes.
- `total_size_deleted` (String) The total size of deleted objects in the bucket in bytes.
- `total_size_unit` (String) The unit of the total size of the bucket.
- `versioning` (String) The versioning status of the bucket. (Value can be 'Enabled', 'Suspended' or 'Disabled')

<a id="nestedatt--tags"></a>
### Nested Schema for `tags`

Read-Only:

- `key` (String)
- `value` (String)
